message.content:
The best skateboard brand for beginners would likely be Element, as they are known for producing high-quality and affordable skateboards that cater to both beginners and experienced riders. They offer a wide range of designs, sizes, and components to choose from.

Other good beginner skateboard brands include:

1. Santa Cruz: Known for their iconic graphics and durable boards.
2. Birdhouse: Founded by professional skater Tony Hawk, the company offers quality complete skateboards designed for all levels.
3. Blind Skateboards: Known for their stylish graphics and well-built decks.
4. Enjoi: Featuring fun artwork and reliable construction suitable for new skaters.
5. Globe Skateboards: Producing versatile skateboards since 1985.

However, it is essential to keep in mind that personal preference also plays a role â€“ what might work perfectly fine for one person may not suit another's preferences or style.

It is highly recommended to visit your local skate shop where you can get advice on which board will suit you best depending on factors like height/weight/skills/experience/etc., or even try different setups before deciding which one suits them most!

Another alternative could be getting an assembled series from any excellent skateboard brand (also called a "complete") because they generally take those factors into consideration already when designing ideal configurations suited towards various categories based upon age/size/experience etcetera; allowing inexperienced individuals just starting out more choice without worrying whether putting together something themselves isn't properly optimized catching onto quickly mastering basics fundamentals enthusiasts learning curve!
